Event.name: Citing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Defendant</fen> is officially summoned to appear in <fen>Court</fen> by an <fen>Authority</fen> (such as the police) based on certain <fen>Charges</fen>. Alternatively, there is often an option for the <fen>Defendant</fen> to pay a <fen>Fine</fen> (thereby admitting their guilt) instead of going to <fen>Court</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Auth">The police</fex> had <t>summonsed</t> <fex name="Dfnd">the wrong man</fex>. <fex name="Chrg">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Tim">Since 1989</fex> nearly a million <t>summonses</t> have been issued <fex name="Dfnd">to people</fex> <fex name="Chrg">for not paying their water bills</fex>. <fex name="Auth">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Auth">The officer</fex> <t>cited</t> <fex name="Dfnd">him</fex> <fex name="Chrg">for riding a bike without a light</fex>.</ex>
Three related frames are Notification_of_charges, Entering_of_plea, and Fining. This frame is distinguished from Notification_of_charges in that it typically deals with less serious <fen>Charges</fen> and/or offenses. It also involves more than just notifying the <fen>Defendant</fen> (Accused in the Notification_of_charges frame) of the <fen>Charges</fen> being brought against them; LUs in the Citing frame also require that the <fen>Defendant</fen> take some form of action (go to <fen>Court</fen> or pay a <fen>Fine</fen>). Similarly, Citing differs from Entering_of_plea because its scenario encompasses more than the latter; Citing involves steps both before and after the <fen>Defendant</fen> enters a Plea in answer to <fen>Charges</fen>. Finally, this frame differs from Fining since the <fen>Defendant</fen> (Payer in the Fining frame) does not necessarily end up paying a <fen>Fine</fen>. He or she may go to <fen>Court</fen> instead. </def-root>

Arg.name: Defendant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Defendant</fen> is the individual or entity summoned to appear in <fen>Court</fen>, or to pay a <fen>Fine</fen> instead.
<ex><fex name="Dfnd">Mrs. Jones</fex> was <t>summonsed</t> for running a red light.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Court
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Court</fen> where the <fen>Defendant</fen> is summoned to appear.
<ex>Police have <t>summonsed</t> Mr. Barnes to appear <fex name="Crt">at the Manchester County Court</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Authority
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Authority</fen> serve a citation or summons to a <fen>Defendant</fen>, requiring that the latter appear in <fen>Court</fen> or pay a <fen>Fine</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Auth">The cop</fex> <t>cited</t> Mrs. Jones for illegal parking.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Charges</fen> identifies the infraction or offense for which the <fen>Defendant</fen> is summoned.
<ex>The cop served Mrs. Jones a <t>citation</t> <fex name="Chrg">for speeding</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fine
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Fine</fen> is the monetary amount that the <fen>Defendant</fen> may pay in certain citation cases, instead of him or her having to appear in <fen>Court</fen>.
<ex>Jason refused to pay <fex name="Fin">the $100 fine</fex> specified by his <t>summons</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Place</fen> is the location where the <fen>Defendant</fen> is issued the citation or summons.
<ex>Police issued Owen a <t>citation</t> <fex name="Pla">on the shoulder of the highway</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Defendant</fen> is issued the citation or summons.
<ex>Molly was <t>cited</t> for driving over the speed limit <fex name="Tim">on Friday</fex>.</ex></def-root>
